<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 293]]<|/det|>
9709/33  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 907, 319]]<|/det|>
May/June 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
On a sketch of an Argand diagram, shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) satisfying the inequalities \(|z - 3 - \mathrm{i}| \leqslant 3\) and \(|z| \geqslant |z - 4\mathrm{i}|\). [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 437, 92]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 100, 636, 129]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{\cos\theta}{2 - \sin\theta}, \qquad y = \theta + 2\cos\theta.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 139, 346, 168]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = (2 - \sin \theta)^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 144, 920, 163]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula based on the equation in (a) to determine \(a\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Express \(3\cos x + 2\cos (x - 60^{\circ})\) in the form \(R\cos (x - \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^{\circ}< \alpha < 90^{\circ}\). State the exact value of \(R\) and give \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 499, 92]]<|/det|>
Use the substitution \(u = \cos x\) to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[364, 98, 636, 134]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{0}^{\pi}\sin 2x\mathrm{e}^{2\cos x}\mathrm{d}x = \int_{-1}^{1}2u\mathrm{e}^{2u}\mathrm{d}u. \quad [4]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 107, 920, 126]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 78, 148, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 547, 104]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{\pi} \sin 2x e^{2\cos x} \, \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 97]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 541, 92]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 100, 559, 135]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{y^{2} + 4}{x(y + 4)}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 144, 485, 164]]<|/det|>
for \(x > 0\). It is given that \(x = 4\) when \(y = 2\sqrt{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 175, 646, 195]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation to obtain the value of \(x\) when \(y = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 176, 920, 195]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 384, 92]]<|/det|>
The lines \(l\) and \(m\) have equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[351, 100, 653, 119]]<|/det|>
\[l\colon \mathbf{r} = a\mathbf{i} + 3\mathbf{j} + b\mathbf{k} + \lambda (c\mathbf{i} - 2\mathbf{j} + 4\mathbf{k}),\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[344, 121, 633, 140]]<|/det|>
\[m\colon \mathbf{r} = \mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + 3\mathbf{k} + \mu (2\mathbf{i} - 3\mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k}).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 147, 700, 166]]<|/det|>
Relative to the origin \(O\), the position vector of the point \(P\) is \(4\mathbf{i} + 7\mathbf{j} - 2\mathbf{k}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 178, 146, 197]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 178, 920, 197]]<|/det|>
Given that \(l\) is perpendicular to \(m\) and that \(P\) lies on \(l\), find the values of the constants \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 196, 920, 214]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The perpendicular from \(P\) meets line \(m\) at \(Q\). The point \(R\) lies on \(PQ\) extended, with \(PQ: QR = 2: 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 395, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(R\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence obtain the expansion of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 104, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 910, 104]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(\mathrm{z}\) is defined by \(\mathrm{z} = \frac{5a - 2\mathrm{i}}{3 + a\mathrm{i}}\), where \(a\) is an integer. It is given that \(\arg \mathrm{z} = -\frac{1}{4}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 114, 146, 131]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 114, 806, 133]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\) and hence express \(\mathrm{z}\) in the form \(x + \mathrm{i}y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 114, 920, 133]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]
